titleStmt.title: The judgments of God upon the Roman-Catholick Church from its first rigid laws for universal conformity to it unto its last end : with a prospect of these near approaching revolutions, viz. the revival of the Protestant profession in an eminent kingdom where it was totally suppressed, the last end of all Turkish hostilities, the general mortification of the power of the Roman Church in all parts of its dominions : in explication of the trumpets and vials of the Apocalypse upon principles generally acknowledged by Protestant interpreters / by Drue Cressener.
titleStmt.author: Cressener, Drue, 1638?-1718.

titleStmt.title: The judgments of God upon the Roman-Catholick Church from its first rigid laws for universal conformity to it unto its last end : with a prospect of these near approaching revolutions, viz. the revival of the Protestant profession in an eminent kingdom where it was totally suppressed, the last end of all Turkish hostilities, the general mortification of the power of the Roman Church in all parts of its dominions : in explication of the trumpets and vials of the Apocalypse upon principles generally acknowledged by Protestant interpreters / by Drue Cressener.
